[ENVIRONMENT].name: ENV
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The logical name of the deployment, must be unique across all environments using the same shared Kafka/Elasticsearch clusters, `a-z (any case)`, `0-9`, `-`, `_` symbols only allowed

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_HOST
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Postgres hostname

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_PORT
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Postgres port

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_USERNAME
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Postgres username

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_PASSWORD
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Postgres username password

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_DATABASE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Postgres database name

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_MAXPOOLSIZE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: This property controls the maximum size that the pool is allowed to reach, including both idle and in-use connections

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_MINIMUM_IDLE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: This property controls the minimum number of idle connections that HikariCP tries to maintain in the pool

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT
[ENVIRONMENT].description: This property controls the maximum number of milliseconds that a client will wait for a connection from the pool

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_IDLE_TIMEOUT
[ENVIRONMENT].description: This property controls the maximum amount of time that a connection is allowed to sit idle in the pool. This setting only applies when `DB_MINIMUM_IDLE` is defined to be less than `DB_MAXPOOLSIZE`

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_KEEPALIVE_TIME
[ENVIRONMENT].description: This property controls how frequently HikariCP will attempt to keep a connection alive, in order to prevent it from being timed out by the database or network infrastructure (0 - disabled)

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_MAX_LIFETIME
[ENVIRONMENT].description: This property controls the maximum lifetime of a connection in the pool

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_VALIDATION_TIMEOUT
[ENVIRONMENT].description: This property controls the maximum amount of time that a connection will be tested for aliveness. This value must be less than the `DB_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT`

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_INITIALIZATION_FAIL_TIMEOUT
[ENVIRONMENT].description: This property controls whether the pool will "fail fast" if the pool cannot be seeded with an initial connection successfully

[ENVIRONMENT].name: DB_LEAK_DETECTION_THRESHOLD
[ENVIRONMENT].description: This property controls the amount of time that a connection can be out of the pool before a message is logged indicating a possible connection leak (0 - disabled)

[ENVIRONMENT].name: OKAPI_URL
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Okapi URL

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_HOST
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Kafka broker hostname

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_PORT
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Kafka broker port

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_SECURITY_PROTOCOL
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Kafka security protocol used to communicate with brokers (SSL or PLAINTEXT)

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_SSL_KEYSTORE_LOCATION
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The location of the Kafka key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_SSL_KEYSTORE_PASSWORD
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The store password for the Kafka key store file. This is optional for client and only needed if 'ssl.keystore.location' is configured.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_SSL_TRUSTSTORE_LOCATION
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The location of the Kafka trust store file.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_SSL_TRUSTSTORE_PASSWORD
[ENVIRONMENT].description: The password for the Kafka trust store file. If a password is not set, trust store file configured will still be used, but integrity checking is disabled.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_CONSUMER_MAX_POLL_RECORDS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Maximum number of records returned in a single call to poll().

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_INSTANCE_AUTHORITY_TOPIC_PARTITIONS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Amount of partitions for `links.instance-authority` topic.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_INSTANCE_AUTHORITY_TOPIC_REPLICATION_FACTOR
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Replication factor for `links.instance-authority` topic.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_INSTANCE_AUTHORITY_STATS_TOPIC_PARTITIONS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Amount of partitions for `links.instance-authority-stats` topic.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_INSTANCE_AUTHORITY_STATS_TOPIC_REPLICATION_FACTOR
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Replication factor for `links.instance-authority-stats` topic.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_AUTHORITIES_CONSUMER_CONCURRENCY
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Number of kafka concurrent threads for `inventory.authority` message consuming.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_INSTANCE_AUTHORITY_STATS_CONSUMER_CONCURRENCY
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Number of kafka concurrent threads for `links.instance-authority-stats` message consuming.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: KAFKA_INSTANCE_AUTHORITY_CHANGE_PARTITIONS
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Number of instance-authority links `links.instance-authority` event contains while processing authority link source change.

[ENVIRONMENT].name: INSTANCE_STORAGE_QUERY_BATCH_SIZE
[ENVIRONMENT].description: Number of instances to retrieve from inventory storage per one request (Max 90 - based on maximum URI length)
